Comment: People have full rights to criticize Jeffries and especially Schumer for their limp-wristed "resistance" or complete lack thereof. The people screeching about the blanket demand for Democrats to "Do Something!" are mostly people who fundamentally do not understand our government, civics, and elections.   Elections have consequences buttercups, you should have voted more wisely and voted your ass off. Democrats don't have the numbers to do much when you decided to protest vote or abstain for "reasons". I'm dismayed by the lack of political brinkmanship and bipartisan strategy from the Democrats, but expecting them to have some sort of effective means of stopping anything when they're in the minority and captive to a complicit Republican party is a bit delusional. I'm mainly chuckling at these citizens screeching about this because again, they just don't understand how anything works or have enough respect for their freedom, rights, and democracy to be bothered with watching a fucking YouTube video that explains this shit like they're 5.   Schumer can get fucked, but until we have an opportunity to vote more Democrats into office during the midterms (if we have them at all, or at least with integrity) we are massively shit out of luck regarding any hard actions the Democrats can take. They are at the mercy of Republican "defectors" to join them to have any chance, and we've seen how fickle they are when it's time to put up. Fucking vote like you life depends on it (because it may very well depend on it), spend a modicum of effort educating yourself on how our government works and on your candidate choices. Americans are acting, as typical, entitled to some outcome they did nothing to help or actively contribute to. The American Electorate contributed to this mess, now it's time for them to also face the music of the reality they wrought through their entitlement, laziness, and taking our country for granted.

Comment: [https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2023/11/mike-johnson-covenant-eyes](https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2023/11/mike-johnson-covenant-eyes)  >[**Mike Johnson**](https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2023/10/mike-johnson-house-speaker) has not even been House Speaker for a full two weeks, but we've managed to learn a tremendous amount about him—most of which could be [charitably described](https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2023/11/mike-johnson-conversion-therapy-group) [as extremely](https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2023/10/mike-johnson-kelly-johnson-onward-christian-counseling-services) [not](https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2023/10/everything-to-know-about-mike-johnson) [good](https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2023/10/mike-johnson-mass-shootings-human-heart). This weekend, though, brought a new category of details about the congressional leader, the response to which has been: WTF?  >The reveal, [via *Rolling Stone*](https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-news/mike-johnson-son-monitor-porn-intake-covenant-eyes-1234870634/amp/)*,* is that as of at least last year, Johnson and his then 17-year-old son monitored each other’s porn usage in an effort to ensure neither was watching any. How, you might ask, could anyone possibly know this? Johnson talked about it publicly in 2022.  [https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-news/mike-johnson-son-monitor-porn-intake-covenant-eyes-1234870634/](https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-news/mike-johnson-son-monitor-porn-intake-covenant-eyes-1234870634/)  >Speaker of the House [Mike Johnson](https://www.rollingstone.com/t/mike-johnson/) admitted that he and his son monitored each other’s [porn](https://www.rollingstone.com/t/porn/) intake in a resurfaced clip from 2022.  >During a conversation on the “War on Technology” at Benton, Louisiana’s Cypress Baptist Church — unearthed by X user Receipt Maven last week — the Louisiana representative talked about how he installed “accountability software” called [Covenant Eyes](https://www.covenanteyes.com/) on his devices in order to abstain from internet porn and other unsavory websites.  >“It scans all the activity on your phone, or your devices, your laptop, what have you; we do all of it,” Johnson told the panel about the app.

It was a statement that even when given the opportunity, Democrats would not use the little power they have to stand up to republicans in congress, which is completely against what not only the rest of the party, but what voters wanted to see. The fact that he wasn’t immediately removed as the minority leader shows how far gone the Democrats are right now. The DNC is in DESPERATE need of new leadership.   When Nancy Pelosi AND AOC both call you out from within your own party, you have really fucked up.
